game.title: A Dragon Named Coal
game.description:
A choice driven RPG set in a dark fantasy world. Play as Coal, a little dragon who wants to be a knight. Coal is a handicapped dragon who has been ostracized from society for his obsession with humans.
If Disney and the manga Berserk had a baby, you’d end up with A Dragon Named Coal. The game has visceral elements of Game of Thrones and doesn’t shy away from mature subject matter. At the same time it focuses on fable based storytelling mechanics.

history.text:
Not all fairytales end happily. A Dragon Named Coal is a dark fantasy epic with Castlevania: Symphony of the Night inspired gameplay and branching story mechanics of Dragon Age: Origins. The game is primarily being created by a husband and wife game studio. Currently we're actively developing for Mac, Windows, Linux and the game will be DRM-Free. With a primary focus on Steam.
A Dragon Named Coal is deeply inspired by the gameplay of Castlevania: Symphony of the Night, Dragon Age: Origins, and Dark Souls. While there are a good number of action RPGs being made. There are few 2D sidescrollers being made that combines gameplay with deep branching story mechanics.
